body:
What happens if you don't use the -d flag. You don't need to use the -d
flag in normal use.

On Fri, 5 Feb 2016, 17:21 arogarth <notifications@github.com> wrote:

> Hi,
>
> here is a small Sample code from my project:
>
> *File:* /home/user/project/main.go
>
> package  main
> import (
>   "github.com/mitchellh/packer/packer/plugin"
> )
> func main() {
>   server, err := plugin.Server()
>   if err != nil {
>     panic(err)
>   }//  server.RegisterPostProcessor(new(plugin.PostProcessor))
>   server.Serve()
> }
>
> If I want to resolve dependencies, the first run failed.
>
> $ cd /home/user/project/go
> $ GOPATH=/home/user/project/go go get -v -d ./...
>
> Error message:
>
> user@PC:~/project$ GOPATH=/home/user/project/go go get -v -d ./...github.com/mitchellh/packer (download)github.com/hashicorp/go-multierror (download)github.com/hashicorp/errwrap (download)github.com/hashicorp/go-version (download)github.com/mitchellh/iochan (download)github.com/mitchellh/mapstructure (download)github.com/mitchellh/reflectwalk (download)github.com/hashicorp/yamux (download)github.com/ugorji/go (download)
> go/src/github.com/mitchellh/packer/builder/docker/communicator.go:18:2: cannot find package "github.com/ActiveState/tail" in any of:
>         /usr/lib/go/src/github.com/ActiveState/tail (from $GOROOT)
>         /home/user/project/go/src/github.com/ActiveState/tail (from $GOPATH)
> go/src/github.com/mitchellh/packer/builder/amazon/chroot/step_create_volume.go:7:2: cannot find package "github.com/aws/aws-sdk-go/aws" in any of:
>         /usr/lib/go/src/github.com/aws/aws-sdk-go/aws (from $GOROOT)
>         /home/user/project/go/src/github.com/aws/aws-sdk-go/aws (from $GOPATH)
> go/src/github.com/mitchellh/packer/builder/amazon/common/state.go:12:2: cannot find package "github.com/aws/aws-sdk-go/aws/awserr" in any of:
>         /usr/lib/go/src/github.com/aws/aws-sdk-go/aws/awserr (from $GOROOT)
>         /home/user/project/go/src/github.com/aws/aws-sdk-go/aws/awserr (from $GOPATH)

>         /usr/lib/go/src/github.com/aws/aws-sdk-go/aws/credentials/ec2rolecreds (from $GOROOT)
>         /home/user/project/go/src/github.com/aws/aws-sdk-go/aws/credentials/ec2rolecreds (from $GOPATH)
